== Main Inclusion Report for Kiosktool ==

=== Requirements ===

# ''Availability:'' <nowiki>[[http://archive.ubuntu.com/ubuntu/pool/universe/k/kiosktool]]</nowiki>; available for all supported architectures
# ''Rationale:''
** Needed for KubuntuKiosktool spec in supported seed
 0. ''Security:''
** <nowiki>[[http://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvekey.cgi?keyword=kiosktool|CVE entries]]</nowiki>: none
** <nowiki>[[http://secunia.com/search/?search=kiosktool|Secunia history]]</nowiki>: none
** No binaries running as root or suid/sgid, but it does install files as root using kdesudo (the upstream version installs using ssh root@localhost)
** Network activity: no network used unless the user specifies to copy files to remote host in which case it uses KDE's kioslaves.
** Source code has been reviewed by Jonathan Riddell for KubuntuKiosktool spec.  Kiosktool was developed by SuSE for their desktop customers.
 0. ''Quality assurance:''
** Package always works out of the box without configuration
** Package asks no debconf questions
** <nowiki>[[http://bugs.debian.org/src:kiosktool|Debian bugs]]</nowiki>: #348888 is already patched by us
** <nowiki>[[http://packages.qa.debian.org/k/kiosktool.html|Maintenance in Debian]]</nowiki> is not moving, in line with upstream
** <nowiki>[[http://extragear.kde.org/apps/kiosktool/|Upstream]]</nowiki> is not moving
** <nowiki>[[http://bugs.kde.org/buglist.cgi?product=kiosk&component=kiosktool&bug_status=UNCONFIRMED&bug_status=NEW&bug_status=ASSIGNED&bug_status=REOPENED|Upstream bug tracker]]</nowiki>: no important bugs
** Package does not deal with hardware
 0. ''Standards compliance:'' 
** <nowiki>[[http://www.pathname.com/fhs/|FHS]]</nowiki>, <nowiki>[[http://www.de.debian.org/doc/debian-policy/|Debian Policy]]</nowiki> compliance ?
** Packaging system cdbs,  Patch system is simple-patchsys, no packaging oddities
 0. ''Dependencies:''
** KDE
** [MainInclusionReportKdesudo]
 0. ''Background information:''
** The general purpose and context of the package is clear from the package's debian/control file
** Upstream call it Kiosktool and always have
